title: SB LX, halftime show fall shy of ratings records
content: Seattle's 29-13 victory over New England in Super Bowl LX averaged 124.9 million viewers, while Bad Bunny's halftime show averaged 128.2 million, both falling short of setting records for most-watched U.S. broadcast and halftime show.

title: LeBron sits out Lakers' loss, ending All-NBA streak
content: The Lakers were without LeBron James, Luka Doncic and Austin Reaves for Tuesday's game against the Spurs. For James, it was his 18th missed game this season, making him ineligible for postseason awards, thus ending his 21-season All-NBA streak.

title: Johnson: 2-seed Spurs should have more All-Stars
content: Mitch Johnson appeared unhappy De'Aaron Fox and Stephon Castle were not named All-Stars, pointing out how the Spurs -- who have the league's third best record -- are not one of the seven teams with multiple All-Stars.

title: Tiger's son commits to play golf for FSU in 2027
content: Charlie Woods, the son of Tiger Woods, has verbally committed to play golf at Florida State and will be a member of the 2027 recruiting class.

title: U.S. hockey posts biggest Olympic win vs. Canada
content: Hannah Bilka scored twice to lead the United States women's hockey team to a dominating 5-0 victory over Canada on Tuesday at the Milan Cortina Olympics.

title: Quinn: QB Daniels could play more under center
content: Commanders coach Dan Quinn said the ability to unlock more from quarterback Jayden Daniels factored into the decision to change offensive coordinators after the season.

title: 'Used Pakistan & threw us like toilet paper': Khawaja Asif's big remark on US
content: Pakistan's defence minister Khawaja Asif lambasted past alliances with Washington, stating Islamabad was "used like toilet paper" after serving US interests in Afghanistan. He described terrorism as "blowback" from dictators' past mistakes, lamenting Pakistan's failure to learn from history and its shifting allegiances for short-term gains. The remarks followed a deadly mosque bombing.

title: General Naravane book row: Delhi Police issues notice to publisher
content: Delhi Police's Special Cell has issued a notice to Penguin Random House India regarding former Army chief General M M Naravane's memoir, 'Four Stars of Destiny'. The publisher clarified the book is not yet published, a stance endorsed by Naravane, amidst a political row over its citation by Rahul Gandhi.

title: T20 World Cup: India‚Äôs strategic shift ahead of Pakistan clash
content: India's bowlers are intensifying their training to adapt to sluggish tournament pitches, particularly in Colombo. The team is also adjusting batting strategies, moving away from an all-out aggressive approach to incorporate more technique. This shift comes as they prepare for challenging conditions and a crucial match against Pakistan at the T20 World Cup.

title: ‚ÄòSC‚Äôs gender handbook too Harvard-oriented‚Äô: CJI says Chandrachud-era primer 'very technical'
content: Chief Justice Surya Kant criticized the Supreme Court's gender stereotype handbook as overly technical and inaccessible to common people and rape survivors. He emphasized the need for practical training for High Court judges on handling sexual assault cases. The bench set aside an insensitive Allahabad High Court ruling on an attempted rape case.

title: Explained: What are India's new AI content rules? All users need to know
content: India has officially regulated AI-generated content, mandating clear labels on platforms like Instagram and YouTube.  Users must now declare AI use, with significant penalties for misrepresentation.  Platforms face stricter takedown timelines and must actively block illegal synthetic media, ensuring transparency for the public.

title: Cabin crew supervisor accuses friend of sexual assault at Gurgaon hotel room
content: A cabin crew supervisor alleged her friend attempted to disrobe and outrage her modesty in a Gurgaon hotel. The woman had allowed him to share her room due to his financial constraints. A case has been registered under relevant sections of the BNS, and the accused is yet to be apprehended.

title: SpaceX delays Mars mission, Elon Musk says: ‚ÄòIt is only possible to travel to Mars when ‚Ä¶‚Äô
content: SpaceX is shifting its near-term focus from Mars to establishing a self-sustaining city on the Moon, citing faster timelines and more frequent launch opportunities. Elon Musk stated a Moon city could be achieved in under 10 years, while Mars would take over two decades.

title: Microsoft appoints its first 'engineering quality head'; here's why that matters
content: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella appointed Charlie Bell as the new head of engineering quality, a move occurring as AI-generated code increases alongside reported bugs. This comes amid challenges with Windows 11 reliability and underwhelming Copilot adoption, raising questions about the company's AI strategy and product quality.

title: T20 World Cup: ICC got tangled in a controversy that wasn‚Äôt
content: The BCCI and BCB both erred in the Mustafizur Rahman IPL release dispute. BCB's "safety concern" pretext for avoiding India, fueled by social media, allowed PCB to create unnecessary drama. ICC chairman Jay Shah prioritised cricket, ensuring the tournament proceeded despite Bangladesh's absence, highlighting the distinct economic value of India-Pakistan matches.

title: Bhel shares plunge 6%! Why is it falling after Rs 4,422 cr OFS opens for subscription?
content: BHEL shares dipped as the government launched an Offer for Sale, aiming to divest up to 5% stake and raise approximately Rs 4,422 crore. The floor price is set at Rs 254 per share. This move follows BHEL's impressive Q3 results, which saw a 206% surge in net profit, driven by enhanced execution and revenue growth.

title: Warriors trade rumors: Grizzlies guard could boost 2026 playoff push
content: Golden State Warriors are eyeing veteran guard Eric Gordon from the buyout market to bolster their bench for the playoffs. Gordon, recently waived by Memphis, offers proven perimeter shooting and playoff experience. His potential low-cost signing could provide crucial spacing and veteran presence alongside Stephen Curry, enhancing the team's offensive depth without disrupting the core rotation.

title: Spurs vs Lakers injury report: Who‚Äôs playing, out and questionable
content: The San Antonio Spurs, riding a four-game winning streak and holding a strong position in the Western Conference, visit the Los Angeles Lakers. The Lakers are significantly hampered by multiple key player injuries, including LeBron James and Luka Donƒçiƒá, impacting their depth and offensive capabilities. San Antonio, with a healthier roster, is favored to win.

title: Ayesha Curry steals spotlight with Stephen Curry at movie premiere
content: NBA star Stephen Curry and his wife Ayesha Curry recently graced the premiere of the animated film 'GOAT' in Los Angeles. Ayesha, who voices a character named Carol, shared photos with Stephen, who lends his voice to Lenny Williamson. The power couple's appearance at the star-studded event generated significant fan excitement and well wishes for their Hollywood venture.

title: Stefon Diggs‚Äô ex steals Super Bowl spotlight amid Cardi B breakup rumors
content: Stefon Diggs‚Äô ex partner was spotted at Super Bowl LX cheering with their baby, drawing attention as rumors swirled about trouble between Diggs and Cardi B. Fans noticed Cardi left after the halftime show and later unfollowed Diggs on Instagram. The contrast between family support in the stands and online silence fueled intense breakup speculation.

title: Pulses dropped, $500bn purchase clause revised: What‚Äôs new in updated India-US trade deal factsheet
content: The US has revised its factsheet on the trade deal with India, notably removing any mention of pulses from the list of agricultural exports. Additionally, the language regarding India's commitment to purchasing American goods has shifted from a firm commitment to an intention to buy, impacting the description of proposed procurements.

title: When Nawazuddin Siddiqui said Rajpal Yadav's house was like a Langar for struggling actors
content: Actor Rajpal Yadav finds himself in hot water, facing jail time over a check bounce case involving a staggering Rs 9 crore, tied to a failed venture in direction. Ironically, an old video featuring Nawazuddin Siddiqui extolling Yadav's philanthropic spirit toward aspiring artists has made a comeback. Read on to know more.

title: 6 dead as car rams into trailer on Jaipur-Agra national highway
content: A Swift Desire car and a trailer collided head-on on Tuesday night near Kailai on National Highway-21 in the Sikandra police station area of Dausa district. All six people in the car died in the accident. Chaos ensued at the scene. Four injured people were brought to Sikandra Hospital, and four were declared dead. One died at Dausa District Hospital, and one seriously injured died during treatment in Jaipur.

title: Exclusive: Mumbai Indians say no to RCB playing IPL matches at DY Patil Stadium
content: Mumbai Indians have denied Royal Challengers Bengaluru permission to use DY Patil Stadium for IPL 2026, citing catchment area restrictions that require an NOC from MI. With Navi Mumbai ruled out, RCB are exploring Raipur and Indore while KSCA continues to push for a return to Chinnaswamy.

title: Faridabad taxi driver stabbed to death after objecting to eve-teasing
content: In a heartbreaking incident in Faridabad, a taxi driver named Jai Singh lost his life after heroically stepping in to defend a young girl from harassment. His bravery in confronting a group of aggressors in a park led to a tragic retaliation, culminating in a fatal attack.

title: Rupee today: Currency dips 6 paise to 90.62 against US dollar
content: The Indian rupee opened weaker against the US dollar on Wednesday, trading at 90.62 due to global geopolitical tensions and import demand. Despite a slight dip in the dollar index, rising oil prices are expected to pressure the rupee further. Meanwhile, Indian stock markets showed a positive start, with the Sensex and Nifty gaining points.

title: ‚ÄòPositive, attacking cricket‚Äô: Farhan sends warning as Pak gear up for India showdown
content: Pakistan opener Sahibzada Farhan has vowed to play attacking cricket against India.  The arch-rivals will face off in Colombo on February 15.  Farhan's confidence stems from his player-of-the-match performance against the USA.  Pakistan captain Salman Ali Agha highlighted the team's balanced batting approach.  The team aims to improve its powerplay bowling before the big match.

title: K-pop, cartoons and online games: Ghaziabad sisters spent 20 hours a day on phone
content: Police investigating the alleged suicides of three sisters in Ghaziabad recovered data from a sold mobile phone, revealing extensive daily use for Korean content, cartoons, and gaming. The recovered material aligns with details mentioned in their suicide note, prompting authorities to seek a ban on specific games.

title: Mecca museum unveils Blue Quran: Viral photos of 1,100-year-old manuscript go viral
content: The Holy Quran Museum in Mecca has unveiled a rare folio from the legendary ‚ÄòBlue Quran‚Äô, a 9th-century manuscript renowned for its deep blue parchment and gold ink. This significant exhibit highlights the rich history of Islamic calligraphy and manuscript art, reinforcing Saudi Arabia's role in safeguarding global religious heritage.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 nears 26,000 mark; BSE Sensex opens over 100 points up
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the main stock market benchmarks, rose in opening trade on Wednesday as global cues remained positive and optimism around the India-US trade deal continued.

title: T20 World Cup: Abhishek Sharma hospitalised ahead of clash vs Namibia
content: Abhishek Sharma has been hospitalised with an infection, casting doubt on his availability for India's next T20 World Cup match. He was unwell before the previous game, with his condition worsening after playing. The left-hander didn't train with the team at the Arun Jaitley Stadium on Tuesday. India will take on Namibia on Thursday.

title: Tendulkar invites PM Modi, Rahul Gandhi for Arjun-Saaniya wedding ceremony
content: Sachin Tendulkar met Rahul Gandhi and invited him, along with President Droupadi Murmu, PM Narendra Modi and Amit Shah, to Arjun Tendulkar and Saaniya Chandok‚Äôs wedding. Arjun, now with Lucknow Super Giants, has had a mixed IPL career and represents Goa domestically. Saaniya is from the Graviss Group family and a longtime friend of the Tendulkars.

title: Relying on HbA1c alone could delay and mislead diabetes diagnosis, warns new India-focused study
content: Millions of Indians may receive inaccurate diabetes diagnoses due to the HbA1c test's limitations, especially in regions with high anemia and hemoglobin disorders. Experts urge a comprehensive approach combining glucose tolerance tests and self-monitoring, warning that relying solely on HbA1c can delay crucial treatment and lead to complications. This highlights a critical flaw in current diabetes assessment.

title: TS TET result declared at tgtet.aptonline.in: Direct link to download scorecards here
content: The Department of School Education, Telangana, has declared the TS TET Results 2026 on February 10. Candidates who appeared for the January examination can now access their scorecards online and check qualifying status. Conducted for teaching eligibility in Classes 1 to 8, the results and final answer key mark a key step toward future recruitment processes.

title: Rajpal Yadav's net worth: From movie fees to brand endorsement income, all you need to know
content: In a shocking turn of events, Bollywood actor Rajpal Yadav finds himself behind bars at Tihar jail due to a bounced check linked to a contentious film investment. His financial situation shows a net worth ranging from Rs 50-85 crore, bolstered by his roles in movies like 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' and 'Chandu Champion'. Read on to know more.

title: TenZ denies Kyedae cheating rumors, explains John Choi trip and calls claims harmful
content: TenZ addressed online rumors claiming Kyedae cheated on him with John Choi. He denied the claims, saying John is a shared friend and photos were taken out of context. He also denied donating bone marrow to Kyedae. Later, TenZ said esports helped him ignore online hate. Kyedae has not commented.

title: After 'India players have superior bats' remark, Rajapaksa makes new post
content: Sri Lanka‚Äôs Bhanuka Rajapaksa clarified his controversial comments on Indian bats, saying his words were misunderstood and meant as praise, not an accusation of bat-tampering. He lauded India‚Äôs advanced cricket system and top bat manufacturers, admitting he should have given clearer context. His earlier remarks triggered online debate, but no ICC complaint was filed.

title: Oscars 2026 luncheon highlights: Ema Stone, Kate Hudson, Michael B Jordan, and others arrive in style
content: The 2026 Oscars nominees luncheon at the Beverly Hilton fostered genuine camaraderie among contenders like Emma Stone and Teyana Taylor. Nominees shared hugs and laughter, celebrating their shared journey and the rare opportunity to connect before the awards ceremony. This event highlighted the personal connections forged amidst fierce competition.

title: Delhi tragedy: Drunk labourer dies after falling into open sewer manhole in Rohini
content: A 30-year-old labourer tragically died after falling into an open sewer manhole in Delhi's Rohini area. The man, identified as Birju Kumar, was reportedly in an inebriated state when he lost his balance and fell into the approximately 14-foot-deep pit on Monday evening. Despite a rescue operation, he was recovered unconscious and later declared dead at a hospital.

title: ICC T20 World Cup 2026: Full Match Schedule For February 11
content: February 11 brings three key T20 World Cup 2026 matches: Afghanistan vs South Africa, Australia vs Ireland, and England vs West Indies. Afghanistan aim to bounce back against a strong Proteas side, while Australia begin their campaign against upset-prone Ireland. England and West Indies, both two-time champions, clash in a high-profile encounter, with both teams in good recent form.

title: Buddhist Monks' 15-Week Walk For Peace Ends In Washington DC

title: Bhopal's 'Eiffel Tower' Is Electrifying, Literally. Drivers Are Worried

content: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney on Wednesday said he was devastated by the "horrific shooting" at a school in the British Columbia district, in which 10 people died.

content: The draft DAP-2026 document has been uploaded on the website of the Defence Ministry, and it seeks comments or suggestions on it from various stakeholders

title: Residents object to relaying of OMR without cold-milling
content: A resident of Perungudi says that in many places the slope was too¬†steep¬†and vehicles find it¬†difficult¬†to climb up the road from the service lane

title: M.G. Ramachandran‚Äôs hospitalisation in the U.S. and homecoming after treatment
content: MGR was flown to America on November 6, 1984, on a chartered Air India flight and was admitted to the Downstate Medical Centre in Brooklyn, New York. At the time of admission, he was not fully conscious after suffering a stroke. Later, he underwent a kidney transplant surgery at the hospital.

title: Chambal aqueduct set to facilitate water supply from river link project in Rajasthan
content: A new Chambal aqueduct in Rajasthan will enhance water supply for drinking and irrigation across 17 districts

title: CM Naidu seeks Central support for irrigation and infrastructure projects in A.P.
content: He expresses concern over Karnataka‚Äôs move to increase height of Almatti dam and seeks ‚Çπ32,000 crore for Polavaram Phase-II and Makhana Development Board in Kolleru region

title: Elderly woman dies, seven injured at temple procession in M.P.‚Äôs Gwalior
content: Deputy Inspector General of Police, Gwalior Range, said that of the seven injured, six are out of danger, while a woman who received serious injuries is currently under observation in Gwalior

title: Only achievable special status for J&K is Statehood: Congress leader Karra
content: It‚Äôs the first time since the reading down of Article 370 that the Congress has openly decided to shun any demand of special status for J&K like the ruling National Conference and Peoples Democratic Party

title: Three women killed by tusker in Odisha
content: The incident happened in Lochapalli village under Dhenkanal Sadar police limits, where several women had gone to Patpuri Reserve Forest to collect firewood

title: Villagers in Odisha boycott anganwadi over appointment of Dalit employee
content: We are making efforts to ensure that the children return so that their pre-school education is not affected, says Child Development Project Officer Deepali Mishra

title: BJP¬†pips Congress to mayor‚Äôs post in Chandrapur¬†with¬†Sena¬†(UBT) help
content: Chandrapur¬†is one of the few municipal corporations in¬†Mahrashtra¬†where the Congress had emerged as the largest party. It won 27 seats, becoming the largest party in the 66-member civic body

content: The High Court ordered registration of an FIR, stating that the truth could only be unearthed through a proper investigation¬†

content: He will attend the AI Impact Summit and hold talks with Prime Minister Narendra Modi to boost ties in key sectors such as trade and defence

title: Kochi Corporation looking for new agency to hand over operation of ro-ro services
content: Ro-ro services are a drain on Corporation resources as they have been reporting huge losses, and the civic body is exploring the possibility of roping in KMRL to manage their operations, says Mayor

title: Lokesh lauds teacher‚Äôs efforts to make teaching a joyful experience
content: Tejasri teaches children moral values, cleanliness, and healthy habits through games and songs, says the HRD Minister

title: Court summons complainant in jewellery theft case related to Sivaganga custodial death
content: So far, 10 police personnel have been named as accused in the custodial death case. The CBI has filed a charge sheet and a supplementary charge sheet

title: DMK should win seats only in single digit in T.N. Assembly poll, says Anbumani
content: He alleges that across the State, people from all sections are extremely angry with the DMK government

title: T.N. likely to become $150 billion electronics hub by 2030, says State Industries Minister T.R.B. Rajaa
content: He points out that the State‚Äôs share in India‚Äôs total electronics exports during FY2025 was around 41% at $15 billion, and this is likely to have increased to 45% in FY2026. He also expresses concern that the Centre has not yet released State-wise data on electronics exports for the current financial year

title: Devadasi survey: 6,222 fresh applications still pending before taluk/district panels in Karnataka
content: Amid questions over the nearly 50% decline in the number of former Devadasis across 15 districts in Karnataka in the latest survey report, 6,222 fresh applications to be included in the list of former devadasis are pending before taluk/district-level committees

title: APSCHE marks quantum milestone with large-scale training initiative
content: Chairman Madhu Murthy says over 1,000 faculty members and 1,00,000 students were trained, with ‚Çπ8 lakh awarded to students during AQVH 2025

title: Trade deal with U.S. ‚Äòbest possible‚Äô amid shifting global order, Foreign Secretary tells House panel
content: Vikram Misri assured the Parliamentary Standing Committee on External Affairs that farmers‚Äô interests would be protected and would not be compromised under the deal

title: Amit Shah calls for urgent action to stem the rot of cyberfraud
content: Cybersecurity is no longer limited to economic security, but is now an integral part of national security, said Mr. Shah

title: Chikkamagaluru farmer cuts sandalwood branches near Vidhana Soudha to protest NHAI action on his farm
content: NHAI has taken over four acres of land at Haliyur for the NH-206 work. Vishu Kumar, a sandalwood grower, alleged that he has been denied a fair compensation

title: Family forced to carry body of relative home on two-wheeler in Andhra Pradesh as government hospital has no ambulance
content: When the impoverished family approached private auto drivers, they demanded up to ‚Çπ2,000 to transport the body. Collector says Bapatla Area Hospital did not have a hearse van as it did not qualify to have one based on mortality figures.

title: Supreme Court asks Election Commission to consider writ petitioner‚Äôs suggestions against excessive poll expenditure
content: Citing a report on poll spending, the petitioner asks for rethink on expenses cap, plan of action against erring candidates; ECI defends its oversight mechanism, questions the report‚Äôs authenticity

title: Stale food seized during raids in Guntur
content: Food Safety and Legal Metrology officials inspect 16 food units across the city, seize cooked food and sweets, and issue notices for hygiene lapses and licence violations

content: Mr. Deepak came into the national spotlight after he confronted a mob of right-wing members accused of harassing a 71-year-old Muslim garment seller and pressuring him to change the name of his shop

title: Congress likely to focus on trade deal as Budget discussion gets underway in Lok Sabha
content: Rahul Gandhi to speak in the House; Opposition agrees to allow normal functioning to raise crucial issues, including the trade deal, during the Budget discussion

title: Retired IB officer to lead peace talks with Naga, Kuki-Zo groups as MHA‚Äôs Northeast Adviser
content: Ajit Lal is a retired IPS officer, former JIC chief, and former IB special director; though the newly-elected BJP recommended him as interlocutor for the Naga peace talks in 2014, he was passed over for R.N. Ravi, now T.N. Governor

title: Election Commission extends deadline for Bengal SIR hearings to February 14
content: Extension follows a Supreme Court order and a request from the Chief Electoral Officer of West Bengal which cited pending hearings, scrutiny, and¬†digitisation¬†work; final rolls to be published on February 28

title: Career progression of Agniveers: Home Ministry sidesteps Rahul Gandhi‚Äôs query

title: Former Army General Naravane confirms Penguin‚Äôs claim that memoir is as yet unpublished as Delhi Police file FIR
content: ‚ÄúNo copies of the book, either in print or digital form, have been published, distributed, sold, or otherwise made available to the public by Penguin Random House India,‚Äù the publishing house said; Gen. Naravane‚Äôs clarification follows remarks by Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, who cited a December 2023 social media post by the former Army Chief to counter the publisher‚Äôs claim

title: Watch: Rohit Pawar questions Ajit Pawar aircraft crash, seeks international probe
content: NCP (SP) leader Rohit Pawar has raised serious questions over whether the aircraft crash involving Ajit Pawar was an accident or a planned conspiracy. He flagged missing technical data, alleged safety lapses and last-minute crew changes, while demanding clarity on fuel practices and flight decisions. Pawar has now called for an independent international investigation alongside the government probe.

title: Why can‚Äôt Human Rights Commission become ‚Äòad hoc‚Äô Information Commission in States with few RTI appeals, asks Supreme Court
content: Chief Justice of India Surya Kant, heading a three-judge Bench, says the ‚Äòad-hoc mechanism‚Äô could continue till the number of RTI appeals increases in ‚Äòdue course of time‚Äô and ‚Äòjustifies the creation of an independent Information Commission‚Äô

title: Opposition questions Centre on price rise, growing inequality in Rajya Sabha

title: ED steps into Tirumala laddu ghee adulteration case

title: VACB opens preliminary inquiry into installation of new flag mast at the Sabarimala Ayyappa temple in 2017
content: The UDF-appointed TDB had ordered the installation under the questionable premise that termites had infested the concrete pillar, which was covered with gold-plated copper cladding, rendering it unstable.¬†Former TDB member and Congress leader Ajay Tharayil denies any wrongdoing and says the decision had the sanction of the High Court-appointed Amicus Curiae

title: Key chord line to ease Secunderabad congestion nears completion
content: Signalling interlocking works are currently underway, after which the section will be opened for traffic; officials estimate that the new route will save up to 30 minutes of travel time, as trains will no longer need to take a 15‚Äëkm detour via Malkajgiri and Lallaguda Gate stations

title: See in photos how the Seahawks stopped the run and won the Super Bowl
content: The defense doesn't often take center stage in the NFL's championship game, but the  Seattle Seahawks ' unit took over in its  29-13 win  against the  New England Patriots  in Santa Clara, California Sunday night. The Patriots were scoreless in their 10 possessions of the game, tying the Colts (Super Bowl III) for the fourth-longest drought to begin a Super Bowl, according to Elias Sports Bureau. The Seahawks' defense held the Patriots to four first downs, 51 total yards, 2.0 yards per play and three sacks in the first half. We captured the plays that secured the Seahawks their second Super Bowl win.
